definition: exterior surface/family relationship via females/to show (one's opinion)/a model/a table (listing information)/a form/a meter (measuring sth)

sentences.english: My friend said he could always arrange his schedule around your schedule.
sentences.chinese: 我朋友說他可以根據你的課程表來調整他上課的時間。

sentences.english: They have timetabled some interesting subjects.
sentences.chinese: 他們已經將一些有趣的科目編入課程表。
於是曼茨教授制定了課程表。

sentences.english: A: What’s your schedule like this year?
sentences.chinese: 你今年的課程表進度怎麼樣？

sentences.english: Sport is no longer so important in the school timetable(= all the subjects that are taught at schools).
sentences.chinese: 體育課在學校的課程表上已不再是重點課。

sentences.english: So Professor Mantz built his curriculum.
sentences.chinese: 於是曼茨教授制定了課程表。

sentences.english: The timetabling problem is one of the most difficult problems in the field of operational research and combinatorial optimization.
sentences.chinese: 課程表問題是運籌學和組合優化中最難的問題之一。

sentences.english: The syllabus is going around the class.
sentences.chinese: 課程表就在這兒傳閱一下。

sentences.english: In school, you had a timetable telling you what to do when.
sentences.chinese: 在學校，有一個課程表可以告訴你何時該做什麼。

sentences.english: The paideia program: an educational syllabus.

definition: to raise a lantern and fight at night (idiom); fig. to work into the night/to burn the midnight oil
to beat sb at their own game (idiom)
student who also works part-time/(old) reform-school student
